page.title: 04MOTOR BIKE SCRAMBLING
page.content: On Carlton Bank there is a scrambling course which is used by a tremendous number of enthusiasts. The course is easy to spot from afar: a large red scar on the hillside. During the summer the course is in use all daylight hours, much to the annoyance of local residents who, along with Parish Councils have pressed the National Parks Committee to stop the activities. The properly organised club say they use private ground in a responsible way, but other cyclists are not so careful. As well as noise being a nuisance there is concern at the misuse of woodland tracks, riding on heather and on footpaths. Problems with parking and disturbance to picnickers have also been reported. As there is concern, an alternative site is sought, leaving a restricted, managed area at the foot of the bank.
